#Text=Follow Gandhian Principles
#Text=Without Feeling Restricted
#Text=Gandhian principles can sometimes feel too restrictive , especially in the present day .
#Text=While ideally someone looking to follow Gandhian principles should follow them to the T , sometimes it can feel overly and lead to you abandoning Gandhism altogether .
#Text=This wikiHow will teach you how to apply the teachings of Gandhi in modern life in a non-restrictive manner , without losing their essence .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Learning About Gandhi 's Principles
#Text=Learn about Gandhi 's principles .
#Text=There are 6 principles that Mahatma Gandhi followed :
#Text=Truth : learning from your own mistakes and conducting experiments on yourself .
#Text=Nonviolence : nonviolent resistance connected in a way to religion .
#Text=Vegetarianism : carved in the Hindu and Jain traditions in India .
#Text=Brahmacharya : spiritual and practical purity .
#Text=Simplicity : giving up unnecessary spending .
#Text=Faith : belief in a higher power and that all religions are real and are equal .
#Text=Learn about the differing circumstances under which you and Gandhi lived .
#Text=These will help you alter the principles so you can live by them without feeling restricted .
#Text=He lived in India from 1869 to 1948 , mainly adhering to these principles in the ' 30s and ' 40s .
#Text=We live in a society that is more technologically advanced , is more materialistic , and does n't fight for the same reasons ( we have more opportunities to do what we want to do )
#Text=Applying Gandhi 's Principle Without Feeling Restricted
#Text=Apply the principle of Truth .
#Text=Fight your own inner demons , fear and insecurities .
#Text=Everyone is unique in this world and therefore , one should not compare with others .
#Text=Be honest with yourself of who you are and what you want .
#Text=If you think there is something to fix , then fix it .
#Text=Practice nonviolence .
#Text=Control your temper and also your thoughts .
#Text=What we think , we become and therefore if you always are thinking of hurting someone or feeling extremely angry at someone , those are the vibes you 'll be giving to others .
#Text=Best way to be nonviolent is to think positively and believe that whatever happens is for a good reason .
#Text=Nonviolence and forgiveness are the higher calling of virtue .
#Text=Resist eating meat .
#Text=Not everyone can resist meat , but you can control your consumption .
#Text=For health reasons , avoiding eating a lot of red meat is a good idea .
#Text=Avoid premarital sex .
#Text=Many of us want to get married and have children or be intimate with someone .
#Text=Therefore , practicing brahmacharya might not be possible .
#Text=However , you ought not think of the opposite sex as an object .
#Text=You could also wait to be intimate with someone till after marriage .
#Text=Gandhi 's life is known to not be a good example of sexual purity , as he used his position to sexually exploit young women .
#Text=This fact , along with his views about racial purity , help us to view Gandhi as a flawed man .
#Text=However , we cannot let the imperfections of men and women deter us from pursuing high ideals and sound principles .
#Text=Principles stand on their own merit , regardless of any individual 's life or level of moral uprightness .
#Text=Avoid consuming more than you need .
#Text=Life in western countries tends to be quite fast .
#Text=Do you need the latest fashion clothing or can you wear the clothes you already have ?
#Text=Do you need 50-100 pairs of shoes ?
#Text=Do you need the latest gadgets ?
#Text=Do you need a brand new BMW ?
#Text=Simplicity does n't mean foregoing all your desires , but not buying something right away or something you do n't really need .
#Text=Simplicity also means being happy with what you are given and have .
#Text=Have faith .
#Text=You do n't have to believe in God , but it is good to believe that everyone has equal inherent value - you are no less or more than someone else .
#Text=It is about knowing your values , ethics and morals .
#Text=Faith is not following others blindly - especially when someone else is doing something that your heart says is not right .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Read books on Mahatma Gandhi .
#Text=Have patience because it is easy to learn a bad habit , but hard to let go of one .
#Text=Understand what you want out of life and know who you are ; in this way you will be following these principles .
#Text=Watch the film ' GANDHI ' ( English film ) on Mahatma Gandhi and ' Lage Raho Munna Bhai ' ( Hindi film )
#Text=See how these principles can fit in your lifestyle and make modifications to your lifestyle where you see it requires
#Text=You can also modify the principles without losing the meaning behind what Gandhi was trying to teach .
#Text=Not all 6 principles need to be followed exactly the same way because your desires and wants also matter .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=If you have decided to change a part of your life , you will need to be patient because there are days when you might fail and then you will need courage to start again .
